sanskrit_verse:
ये द्विजानामपसदा ये चापध्वंसजाः स्मृताः ।
ते निन्दितैर्वर्तयेयुर्द्विजानामेव कर्मभिः ॥ १०.४६॥
transliteration:
ye dvijānāmapasadā ye cāpadhvaṃsajāḥ smṛtāḥ |
te ninditairvartayeyurdvijānāmeva karmabhiḥ || 10.46||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those born of degraded twice-born lineages, or those who have fallen from their dharmic status, shall conduct themselves solely through the actions prescribed for the twice-born, as a means of purification and realignment.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from alignment with dharma, not birth alone
Causation is rooted in conscious action and energetic resonance
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by spiritual readiness, not social rank
Restoration logic operates through disciplined repetition of purified conduct
Consciousness alignment supersedes inherited or assigned identity
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent's conduct deviates from svadharma due to lineage degradation THEN assign remedial engagement in purified conduct of higher varna
IF agent exhibits apasada condition THEN initiate structured reintegration via dvija-karma protocols
IF agent completes prescribed dvija-level duties THEN restore eligibility for original dharma status
IF agent refuses alignment THEN continue cycle until capacity觉醒 occurs
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating disputes involving individuals whose dharma status has been compromised due to ancestral or personal degradation, the court must recognize that true authority stems from alignment with dharma, not mere inheritance. The threshold of responsibility lies in initiating restorative protocols rather than punitive measures. Hierarchy is based on consciousness-readiness, not birth privilege.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that deviation arises from misalignment, not inherent fault. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that purified conduct leads to sequential restoration. Proportional responsibility aligns with the degree of dissonance from svadharma. Non-punitive reality is upheld by treating all beings as capable of realignment through correct action.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process through ritualized adherence to dvija duties
Assign mentorship under qualified dvija guide for behavioral recalibration
Implement daily consciousness review sessions to track energetic shift
Establish accountability cycles tied to lunar calendar for sustained integration
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: Dharma flows from consciousness, not caste. All beings may ascend through purified action. Reality is non-punitive; restoration is assured. Consciousness is the Supreme Adjudicator.
